sections.chapter: Chapter 1: Introduction to CoreBluetooth & BLE Basics

inlineContent.text: Understand the basic concepts of Bluetooth Low Energy
and the structure of the CoreBluetooth framework.
There are two main roles in BLE communication.
Understand the relationship between Central and Peripheral.
Understand the data structure of BLE.
The hierarchy of Services and Characteristics is key.
BLE is a low-power wireless communication technology introduced in Bluetooth 4.0.
Unlike classic Bluetooth, it’s optimized for intermittent data transmission with minimal power consumption.
BLE Characteristics:
Low Power
: Can operate for years on a coin battery
Fast Connection
: Connection established within milliseconds
Small Data
: Ideal for healthcare and IoT sensors
Wide Support
: iOS, Android, embedded devices
Import CoreBluetooth and
explore the basic structure.
UUIDs are unique values that identify services and characteristics.
Understand the difference between standard and custom UUIDs.
CoreBluetooth is Apple’s framework for BLE communication.
You can implement both Central and Peripheral roles.
Main Classes:
: Manages the Central role
: Manages the Peripheral role
: A connected peripheral device
: A service provided by the device
: A characteristic containing actual data
Add the Bluetooth permission key to Info.plist.
Write the description message that will be shown to users.
To use Bluetooth in an iOS app,
you need to add permission descriptions to Info.plist.
Bluetooth usage permission request is required on iOS 13+.
Central scans for nearby devices, initiates connections,
and requests data as the client role.
iPhone apps typically act as Central.
Central
Peripheral
Peripheral advertises itself and waits for connections.
Heart rate bands, smart lights, etc. are Peripherals.
Observer
Observer is not a BLE role.
Central and Peripheral are the two main roles.
Which role in BLE finds devices and initiates connections?
What is the correct BLE data hierarchy structure?
Characteristic > Service > Peripheral
Peripheral contains Services,
and Services contain Characteristics.
Peripheral > Service > Characteristic
A Peripheral device provides multiple Services,
and each Service contains multiple Characteristics.
Data is read from and written to Characteristics.
Peripheral is at the top level and contains Services.
Service > Peripheral > Characteristic
Standard services defined by Bluetooth SIG
use 16-bit UUIDs.
The heart rate service is 0x180D.
32-bit
BLE doesn’t use 32-bit UUIDs.
It’s either 16-bit (standard) or 128-bit (custom).
128-bit
128-bit is used for custom UUIDs.
Standard services use 16-bit.
What is the UUID length for the standard heart rate service?
